intro: Diodia teres f. latifolia, commonly known as broad-leaved diodia, is a variant of the species Diodia teres, belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, sandy soils. This plant is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local flora diversity.
